oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Excerpt 1 from oral history interview with Roger DuVal Baskette, Sr., 2003 February 03
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An excerpt from an oral history interview with Roger DuVal Baskette, Sr., conducted on 3 February 2003 by Robert P. Richardson as part of the Nashville Public Library's Veterans History Project. Baskette, a gunner in the 90th Chemical Mortar Battalion, III Corps, U.S. Army from 1942-1946, discusses his most vivid war memories, including seeing a thousand-plane Flying Fortress raid over Germany and his involvement in the battle for the Remagen bridgehead. The complete interview, as well as a transcript, is available in the repository.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Baskette, Roger DuVal, 1924- --Interviews
